intro: Impatiens deqinensis, commonly known as the Deqin touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy and glandular. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
